thread.title: Spurs' hiring of Becky Hammon kicked off pro sports revolution
thread.title_full: Spurs' hiring of Becky Hammon kicked off pro sports revolution - San Antonio Express-News

author: Dan McCarney
title: Spurs' hiring of Becky Hammon kicked off pro sports revolution
text:
Photo: Rick Scuteri, AP Image 1 of / 16 16 Line judge Sarah Thomas waits for play to resume during the first half of an NFL preseason football game between the Arizona Cardinals and the Kansas City Chiefs, Saturday, Aug. 15, 2015, in Glendale, Ariz.
Photo: Rick Scuteri, AP Line judge Sarah Thomas waits for play to resume during the first... Image 2 of 16 In this Aug. 15, 2015, file photo, Arizona Cardinals coach Jen Welter is shown prior to an NFL preseason football game against the Kansas City Chiefs in Glendale, Ariz. Her groundbreaking stint as coaching intern with the Arizona Cardinals is nearing an end, and Jen Welker has one word to describe the experience _ ``Fantastic.''
Photo: Rick Scuteri, AP In this Aug. 15, 2015, file photo, Arizona Cardinals coach Jen... Image 3 of 16 Beth Mowins is surrounded by men including fellow broadcaster Tom Flores (left) as she watches a workout Wednesday August 12, 2015. Beth Mowins is the new play by play announcer for the Oakland Raiders for their preseason games. She watched a practice recently in Napa, Calif. where the team has training camp.
Buy this photo Photo: Brant Ward, The Chronicle Beth Mowins is surrounded by men including fellow broadcaster Tom... Image 4 of 16 Nancy Lieberman , who was the first head coach of a men's professional team in the D-League, returned to coaching men as an assistant with the Kings.
Photo: Tony Gutierrez, STF Nancy Lieberman , who was the first head coach of a men's... Image 5 of 16 Jessica Mendoza , MLB broadcast announcer
Photo: 2013, ESPN Inc. Jessica Mendoza , MLB broadcast announcer Image 6 of 16 WNBA star Becky Hammon is the first female full-time assistant coach in the NBA. Click through the gallery for 9 things you probably didn't know about her.
Photo: Kin Man Hui, Express-News WNBA star Becky Hammon is the first female full-time assistant... Image 7 of 16 1. Becky Hammon became the first female full-time, paid assistant coach in the NBA after she was hired by the Spurs on Aug. 5, 2014. Hammon will also be the first full-time female coach in any North American male professional sports league.
Photo: Kin Man Hui / San Antonio Express-News 1. Becky Hammon became the first female full-time, paid assistant... Image 8 of 16 2. Hammon is a longtime standout player for the San Antonio Stars and was named one of the Top 15 Players in WNBA history in 2011 .
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, San Antonio Express-News 2. Hammon is a longtime standout player for the San Antonio Stars... Image 9 of 16 3. Coach Gregg Popovich said Hammon's hiring was based on her knowledge , not her gender, after announcing the hire. "Having observed her working with our team this past season, I'm confident her basketball IQ, work eithic and interpersonal skills will be a great benefit to the Spurs," he said.
Photo: Robin Jerstad / For The Express-News 3. Coach Gregg Popovich said Hammon's hiring was based on her... Image 10 of 16 4. Hammon, who played in Russia during the offseason, won a bronze medal while playing for the country in the 2012 Olympic Games on Aug. 11, 2012, in London, England. Hammon became a Russian citizen after not being invited to the U.S. Olympic team.
Photo: Christian Petersen, Getty Images 4. Hammon, who played in Russia during the offseason, won a bronze... Image 11 of 16 5. Hammon caught a baby bonnethead shark while fishing in Florida during the 2009 offseason.
Photo: COURTESY PHOTO 5. Hammon caught a baby bonnethead shark while fishing in Florida... Image 12 of 16 6. Born in South Dakota in 1977, Hammon's father was her first basketball mentor. She averaged more than 25 points per game her senior year at Stevens High School and played college ball at Colorado State University.
Photo: The Denver Post, Getty Images 6. Born in South Dakota in 1977, Hammon's father was her first... Image 13 of 16 7. Hammon was undrafted out of college and was signed by the New York Liberty in 1999.
Photo: Otto Greule Jr, Getty Images 7. Hammon was undrafted out of college and was signed by the New... Image 14 of 16 8. Hammon announced her plans to retire in 2014 after playing 16 seasons in the WNBA and the last eight with the Stars. She was chosen for the All-Star team seven times and is the Stars' career leader in assists, 3-pointers and points per game.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas / San Antonio Express-News 8. Hammon announced her plans to retire in 2014 after playing 16... Image 15 of 16 9. Hammon dealt with a slew of injuries during her lengthy career in the WNBA, including a torn ACL and a broken middle finger that have sidelined her in recent seasons.
Photo: For The Express-News 9. Hammon dealt with a slew of injuries during her lengthy career... Image 16 of 16 Spurs' hiring of Becky Hammon kicked off pro sports revolution 1 / 16 Back to Gallery The Spurs had absolutely no interest in starting a revolution when they hired Becky Hammon as the first full-time female assistant coach in the history of U.S. professional sports.
Indeed, they didn’t reference her gender at all when announcing the hire last August. And as Gregg Popovich would say later, “It doesn’t matter if you’re a man or a woman,” Popovich said. “It’s the same pick-and-roll.”
RELATED: Becky Hammon crosses another item off her bucket list - from the sky
Others were apparently watching. As noted last week by Fortune magazine , no fewer than six other women have since attained prominent positions within the bounds of professional sports:
Sarah Thomas, NFL referee Jen Welter, NFL coaching intern Beth Mowins, NFL broadcast announcer Nancy Lieberman, NBA assistant coach Jessica Mendoza, MLB broadcast announcer Jessica Siegal, MLB instructional coach It certainly could be a coincidence. But given the success the Spurs have had with Hammon, who fit seamlessly with Popovich’s veteran staff before leading the summer league squad to victory in Las Vegas, it’s hard to imagine their historic hire didn’t have at least some influence on the sudden female influx.
If so, Hammon gladly serves as a torchbearer.
“I hope this opens the door for more women to walk through and make a spot at the table in men’s professional sports,” she said earlier this summer . “Guys don’t have to get up and leave the table. Just scoot over a little bit.”
